intro: Nierembergia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Nierembergia pilosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
